column9: The only time I am not in pain is when I take a voltaren every evening with dinner.  It keeps me feeling good enough to do regular household chores comfortably.  It is a big help.

column2: weathergirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Voltaren for my plantar fasciitis pain.  I am careful to take it on a full stomach and usually have no stomach upset.  On the downside, I have noticed increased hot flashes when using this regularly for more than a few days.  Although I do not like the risks associated with NSAIDS, this medicine worked to alleviate my foot pain when nothing else did.

column2: pg,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I use Volteren Gel 1% in addition to a brand name anti-inflamatory.   Voltaren Gel is very effective used in areas that may need a little extra anti-inflamatory help.  However, my insurance company suggested I try another drug similar to the name brand  The perscribed med was diclofenac sodium ec which is generic for Voltaqren.  Sorry to say that without the name brand anti-inflamaatory I have many areas that have become stiff and hurt. My left hand was under control & now it hurts to open & close my hand.

column2: e.mae7, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm taking Voltaren to manage chronic spinal and joint pain caused by the combination of a 4-year-old spinal injury, sacroiliac and other joint dysfunction and hypermobility.  Although I do not have RA, I have many similar debilitating symptoms.  I take 50 mg twice daily, and while I'm afraid I may need to either increase my dosage or change to a COX-2 inhibitor, Voltaren has been life-changing for me for the 8 months I've been taking it.
